intro: Pouteria stellibacca, commonly known as the star-stemmed soursop, is a tropical plant belonging to the Sapotaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, warm climates. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, green, spiny fruits. The fruit has a distinctive star-shaped stem and a sweet, aromatic pulp with a texture similar to a soursop. It is valued for its edible fruit and has traditional uses in local cuisines and medicine.
